page.title: 15THE STROUD WORKHOUSE
page.content: { Map Ref:-865052 The Workhouse was built in 1837.It covered 37,000 square feet.Although workhouses were supposed to be terrible places,the workhouse in Bisley Old Road was one of the most up to date and modern workhouses.The old people that were living there were treated fairly well.It took a great deal of money to keep all the occupants fed for 1 year. In the Second World War it was declared unfit for human habitation and was used by the British soldiers until the Americans were billeted there.After the Second World War it was used by the Council as a County Council Store.There is supposed to be a ghost haunting the house, footsteps have been heard but no one was there.It is now being used as flats.
